title: Response to Gosthcrawler about addons on league
body:
Ghostcrawler said (link:http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=46645813#46645813):

"*I think this brings up a great philosophical discussion. We tried hard on WoW not to "save players from themselves," and on the occasions when we did I'm not convinced it ended up well. One result of this philosophy is we gave third-party mods great latitude in how they re-sculpted the UI of the game. It's clear many players enjoyed the ability to customize or express themselves, and it's probably also fair that the default UI didn't provide all of the information it needed to (which is why we're having the conversation about jungle timers for League). 

On the other hand, it's one of those great power comes great responsibility deals. I always felt the boss addons for WoW for example frequently provided way too much information just because they could. (Sure they were customizable and players could turn off things they didn't strictly need, but I'm not sure how many made that effort.)  When your HUD resembles that of a commercial airliner, it's hard to know what are the bits as a player that you actually need to pay attention to. Does that mean we should have stepped in and tried to prevent the over-UI-ification of the game? I'm not sure. Thoughts?

I know slippery slope arguments are a potent weapon in the arsenal of the internet, but that doesn't mean League add-ons have to go this route either. We think there is room for a lot of improvement in the default UI of League, and we want to support and offer guidance to third-parties who want to do their own thing. How do we all (and I'm purposely including you guys here) know when things go too far and the add-ons cross over into garish or bloated constructs that bury players in barely-useful displays?*"




My response:

I see your concern for the UI clutter, but really the major concern should be the fact that allowing addons is gonna change an UI that has been so far a fair playing field for most people. What is fair to be automated by an addon and what is considered a skill in LoL cannot be plainly shown to everyone so that everyone can agree (map awareness, las hitting, skill timers, jungle timers, damage calculation, etc.) So i don't think any arbitrary opinion based on a experience of the game should decide this, so everyone should get the same UI options (meaning an official UI and no addons from third parties)  

This is not just a slippery slope argument I'm talking about curse voice that is allowed already:

If riot and the majority of the community want the allied ult timers that CV provides , then everyone should have them by default in their UI,same with voice chat that's easy to access for random teams in soloque (obviously with the option to turn on and off). Letting addons provide such useful information and tools will skew the fair playing field. 

Also you should know all the trouble addons can cause bugs and problems keeping up with the official game updates and having to uninstall them when you run into bugs but this is just secondary point with my main one being enough reason to stay away from them.

edit: why do html format commands don't work?

replies.body:
Gostcrater? Gothcrawler?

Seriously though, we appreciate the feedback. We realize this is a multi-faceted issue with a lot of nuance and strong opinions.

As I mentioned recently, we're still gathering feedback before we talk about our next steps, and I'm not directly a member of the team coming up with our improved guidelines for players, though I am part of that conversation.

Personally i dont feel that 3rd party programs at all should be allowed, if Riot sees something that could improve the game they should implement it themselves, not have it so only some players can have access to an advantage,regardless of how small the advantage may be.

on the P.S. : independent platform, click the question mark in the top right of the comment box for a basic formatting guide. I made an advanced one if it is wanted.  
---  
As this is a public discussion I would suggest to link the post where Ghostcrawler said this so we (well, me at least) aren't just taking your word for it.
---
my $0.02: 
Let's use voice chat as an example. It's a clear strategic advantage, LoL does not have it default and it's actually a (imho) horrible idea to be implemented for numerous reasons which I can go into in detail if wanted. To get around this a lot of players use Skype and other 3rd-party voice sharing services to communicate. While this does give a small advantage everyone on the call is (I'm assuming) on the same team and has access to the exact same information so they cannot glean anything they couldn't have by themselves in the exact same moment it just makes it easier to relay across the board.

CV does the same thing but automated. From what I understand of CV it does not advise a course of action or otherwise direct you anywhere it just displays current information that the current UI also shows, it just makes it more obvious. I attribute more to like using reading glasses to read, some may flat out need it and most will eventually find them *convenient* but there are yet others who can go on without them and be perfectly fine.

And on the side-note for updates, imo Riot should specifically not care about mod updates and their compatibility. It's the mod author's *job* to keep the mod usable. If that becomes a problem then the issue is with mod and its creators not Riot or their game.

dragon and baron count downs are not part of the game currently. 

I have no problem with voice chat in general but i am irked that riot is allowing a partner to literally modify the adobe and game client. This is really bad and takes away form serious competitive environments.

I'm not really a fan of a strictly standardized UI, I enjoy customization options. I do share your worry about 3rd party access to the client and the possible issues it can create but I also like the stance GC is taking on a specifically UI standpoint.

What every competitive game has going for it is the fact that customs mods at a big no.

I come from competitive l4d and TF2. The server options allowed for the disabling of all custom material to enforce these rules. Some leagues also made anti hack detection programs that were required on everyone's client to do detect hook ins. 

League is a ladder game therefore it is strictly competitive. You may have causal people who do not care but that does not change what the game is. Allowing mods is literally a slap in the esport (not just at riot) creditably.

League is the NAME of national/global recognized esports. Governments actually recognize this game as serious and give visa's for it.

I would be kind of ok with mods if they kept them out of ranked (consistency with the fact that they won't allow curse voice in pro play), but really we don't need them they should just buy the code from their third parties and implement it how they see fit.

Inb4 skins with keyloggers in them. Third party program allowance is a bad policy and always will be. A company letting third party applications be installed into their program to do things that their program should offer to begin with is lazy, and worse, opens up a huge window for security and privacy risks for not only the add-on users but anyone that plays with them.

Link is up. Seems like we agree so not much to discuss? On the updates and mods I agree but i think it is indeed another reason why mods would be undesirable specially if the mods give advantages and become the standard for competitive play (because you would want to have them and would have to deal with the problems that come with them as opposed to having this UI updates added to the offcial UI). There's also the fact that they affect the performance of the game.

When it comes to mod interference, to clarify, I file that under 'your mod, your problem' personally.

On mods in competitive, I'm impartial. Mods are purely reactionary to changes Riot makes. If there's a mod Riot likes enough, they can just absorb it, if there's a mod they don't like they can block it. But I feel the majority will be like CV and be more of Quality of Life improvements.

so you don't consider CV to give advantages in competitive pvp? ( btw imo LoL is all about competitive pvp , except co-op vs AI obviously) I consider the easy to acces voice chat for random teams in soloque and the ally ult timers to be clear advantages for pvp since there is no practical way to do this with out CV.

I think it gives a negligible advantage. The default UI has ult indicators to show when ally ults are available already and voice chat with random people is just not as much of an advantage as it's made out to be. Once an entire second can decide a game (imo Plat and above) players usually have enough experience to not need more than pings, the mini-map and their own in-game knowledge. 

Lower than that the second or two saved from CV's tools don't have nearly as much of an impact in the average game. Sure there will be exceptions but when it comes to presented information influencing a decision CV does not give enough to truly impact gameplay. 

Again from what I understand of CV currently, which is voice chat que and automated timers.

The scope of the advantage does not really matter for my argument(and it is a matter of opinion and that's part of the main problem I'm criticizing too) the advantage is there , however small according to you, i differ, because my argument criticizes the principle. 

There are on/off indicators very different from countdown timers that take into account ultimate level and CDR, imo you can't keep track of the 5 ultis in that fashion mentally, with all the other information you have to process, so it is an advantage that can't be achieved without the addon.

I disagree about voice chat too, i think it is the one of the main reasons why premades usually beat randoms, and in LoL we have a different queue for premades and duos in soloque get an inflated MMR.

Also saying that unskilled players would not reap the advantages of the tools and information this addons provide does not affect my argument either(cause they are still there and people are going to want them and other people that see others using them will want them too and so the mods arm race begins) Also i think it is debatable, I think the ultimate timers will help low skill people a lot, like me in silver.

I'm S5. I recently got CV.

There have been a couple (2) times that I've gotten an advantage from being able to access dragon and baron timers more quickly. As to allied ult timers, all it's done for me is saved me having to ask, "WW no ult?" Which is a really nice thing, because asking them that implies you're doubting them (which I am, but which I don't really want to tell them because it's not constructive). But it't not a competitive advantage.

I never said a lower elo player wouldn't benefit, I apologize if I came off that way. I intended to say that on average the advantage gained in lower elo would not be enough to decide a game's outcome if the add-on did not come into play.  

Voice chat is very debatable but branching off into a related, but already popularly discussed topic. Some people want it and some people don't, I respect your view and understand it but I'll agree to disagree.  

Overall, I think I'm just trying to argue a separate point and I haven't been clear about it, I'm sorry about that. I agree that add-ons like CV that better represent 'earned information' give an advantage, but I simply disagree it is a significant enough advantage to worry about it. In my eyes you can still function on the same level without it against someone with it as long as the add-on does not give you information you would not normally have. Even precision information like exact ult cooldowns are still good under that because the number of times where those 5 secs or so (the time when knowing an ult's exact refresh time will be a true advantage against the current UI) will affect a decision come up very, very rarely.

This is a response i gave from a conversation on the forums with someone with a similar point of view as you Sir ArmaMalum:

I think CV is going to become the standard in ranked soloqueue, i think the voice chat and the ally ult timers that take into account ult levels and CDR, which are much better than the green on/off dots, are good enough to cause it to become widely spread and finally the standar mod. I have always trusted riot judgement like you seem to do, but the recent responses from rioters in this topic has shaken my trust sadly. I'm still waiting for are reasonable address of all the valid complains the community has put forward. I really hope they monitor the MMR of the people using this vs not using it and disable it if it affects it even if it is not something big, and i think it will affect it. And eventually add this features to their UI if they deems it a good thing.
